alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall; Panola; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:53PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lafayette, southwestern Marshall, eastern Tate and northeastern Panola Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 553 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Barr, or 13 miles west of Wall Doxey State Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holly Springs, Wall Doxey State Park, Barr, Harmontown, Independence, Laws Hill, Marianna, Malone, Wakefield, Waterford, Aiken, Crossroad, Tyro, Gilton, Chulahoma, Glenville, Galena, Poagville, Blackwater and Teckville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Mississippi.
